This version features a complete revamp of the keyboard's revision mode to make it easier for you to polish long-form messages:
• Improved navigation between issues in text with automatic cursor jumping
• A fresh new design that makes it clear why
This release features a lot of stability improvements, specifically in text editing. Thanks for your feedback!

You can now long-tap on particular keys to get alternative characters, symbols, and website domains
Added support for Australian and Canadian English
Added a setting to show uppercase letters all the time

This version includes on-device learning for commonly confused word pairs. More you type – better auto-correct precision you get. Also, we have improved splitting jammed words when you miss the space bar.

This version includes on-device learning for commonly confused word pairs. More you type – better auto-correct precision you get. Also, we have improved splitting jammed words when you miss the space bar.

This major update to the Grammarly Keyboard includes three exciting features:

The keyboard now can predict multiple words at once, which makes typing even faster. For example, if you type "I'm pre", the keyboard will suggest "pretty sure that". You

This major update to the Grammarly Keyboard includes three exciting features:

The keyboard now can predict multiple words at once, which makes typing even faster. For example, if you type "I'm pre", the keyboard will suggest "pretty sure that". You

• You can now ignore an auto-correct if you prefer to keep the original spelling
• You can tap and hold the spacebar to move the cursor
